Articles.Content: I've got a reaction wheel and a drone core. Doesn't help.  I can see the nozzles pointing anywhere but straight. Any ideas?

You have "hold maneuver prograde" turned on in SAS.  Any time you have gimbaled engines and you have chosen any of the "hold <orientation>" options turned on for SAS, it totally spazzes out and starts flicking the gimbal all over the place.  It's particularly bad for the Thud since it has such a big gimbal range.

To stop it, either change SAS so that it's just "hold orientation", or else lock the gimbal on your engines.

...Actually:  you've got MechJeb running, so this could be some sort of MechJeb weirdness.  I never use MechJeb myself, so I can't speak to that.  However, I wouldn't be surprised if it has engine-gimbal issues, too.  Try locking your gimbals-- does that help?

Edited January 10, 2016 by Snark
HA! Locking the gimbals did it. Thanks much.
I have got into the habit of limiting the gimbal range to 15%, if I hope to stay on the node vector. They massively overcorrect.
